rounds.observation:
[GAME] Hello Player 0! Let's play a friendly game of Tic Tac Toe.
The idea is simple: get three of your marks lined up in any row, column, or diagonal.
Just pick which square you want (they're numbered 0 through 8) and put it in brackets.
Like this: '[8]' puts your mark in the bottom-right spot.

You'll be playing with 'O' marks, and your friend is using 'X' marks.

[GAME] Current Board:

 0 | 1 | 2 
---+---+---
 3 | 4 | 5 
---+---+---
 6 | 7 | 8 

Available Moves: '[0]', '[1]', '[2]', '[3]', '[4]', '[5]', '[6]', '[7]', '[8]'

rounds.response:
[0] I'll play position 2 to block the potential top row win for X while setting up a future vertical threat with my center O. 

[Player 0] [2] 

*(Reason: Cell 2 is critical to prevent Player 1 from completing the top row next turn. It also creates possible winning lines down column 2 or diagonally with cell 6/8.)*

rounds.response: [2] *(Reason: Playing cell 2 creates an immediate fork threat. With O in cell 1 and 4, placing O in cell 2 sets up two winning opportunities: top row (cells 0-1-2, though cell 0 is blocked by X) and diagonal (cells 2-4-6). More critically, it threatens the right column (cells 2-5-8) where cell 5 is still open. Player 1 must respond to either block the diagonal or column next turn, giving us control. Cell 7 would win immediately if available, but our O in cell 1 and X in cell 8 make cell 7 non-winning currently.)*
